greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A009194(A250246(n)) = gcd(A250246(n), A324545(n)).
comment: Positions where a(n) == A250246(n) are: 1, 6, 28, 120, 496, 864, 8128, 11424, 15240,  ..., which is sequence A250245(A007691(n)) sorted into ascending order.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: ordinal_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), pt); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), pt = mapget(om, invec[i]), pt = 0); outvec[i] = (1+pt); mapput(om,invec[i],(1+pt))); outvec; };
A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ From A003961
xref: Differs from A009194 for the first time at n=39. Here a(39) = 3.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 06 2019
